solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = _{j}_\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{_{j}_}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{_{j}_}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {_{j}_\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = _{{trunc(sqrt((j*7)/(Decimal('3')*22)), 2)}}_ cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = _{{trunc(sqrt((j*7)/(Decimal('3')*22))*Decimal('0.5'), 2)}}_ cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = _{{trunc( pi_val * ((j*7) / (Decimal('3')*22)) * sqrt((j*7)/(Decimal('3')*22))*Decimal('0.5') , 2)}}_ cm^3\)

content.text: A solid cylinder has total surface area of _{j}_ square centimetres. Its curved surface area is one-third of its total surface area. Find the volume of the cylinder in cubic centimetres
